description.narrative: A total of 12 mentors (Senegal: 3 ; Mali: 3; Niger: 3; Côte d’Ivoire: 3), selected by the local partnering schools of journalism, have benefited, similarly with the editors, from a training on a) women’s rights and rights to information according the national, regional and international frameworks; b) gender sensitive journalism (indicators); c) monitoring the journalists and assessing their contents.

Mentors had been selected by the schools of journalism on technical criteria (recognition as senior and respected journalists; experience in formal training or in in-house coaching). However, though generally open to women’s rights and equality, they had no experience on gender sensitivity journalism coaching or mentoring.
